intro: Stellaria decandra, commonly known as mouse-ear chickweed, is a small annual herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features slender, often hairy stems. The plant has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually hairy on both surfaces. Its flowers are small, white, and star-shaped, with five petals, and are arranged in loose clusters. Stellaria decandra is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along paths, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various conditions.
